meaning: To scold; now, usually, to reprove mildly.
To admonish in blame; to reproach angrily.
(intransitive) To make a clamorous noise; to chafe.
sentences: She didn't chide me for calling early.
He will not chide continually, nor keep his anger still.
This is not the time or place to chide anyone, scold anyone, or roll out complicated policies and procedures.
A'Ran knew he should chide her as he would his sisters and remind her of her place, but the words died before reaching his lips.
